headline: Classic Frozen Strawberry Margarita
description: This frozen strawberry and lime margarita with tequila is a deliciously refreshing fruity drink that's perfect for summer. Sure to be a hit!
name: Classic Frozen Strawberry Margarita
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon white sugar, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place strawberries, tequila, lime juice, triple sec, and 1 teaspoon sugar in a blender; blend until smooth.
Add ice cubes; blend on high until ice is crushed, about 15 seconds.
Rub lime wedge around the rim of a glass. Spread 1 teaspoon sugar onto a plate. Dip glass rim in sugar to coat; pour margarita into the glass.

review.reviewBody: Proportions made for a nice, refreshing cocktail. I know it's a matter of taste, but my wife and I added just a touch more sugar as it was slightly tart to our taste.
One of the best recipes I've tried so far! Good mix of flavors.
No ice - just used frozen individual strawberries I had frozen. Added a bit of simple syrup to sweeten them up. Yummy!

I thought this was pretty good. I thought the tequila was a bit strong and overpowered the strawberries, but no one else that I shared these with thought so, so I think it's just a personal preference. Thanks for sharing this recipe!
I would add less lime and double the amount of ice. I multiplied everything by 4 (minus the lime; x8 for the ice) and it came out perfect! Definitely using this recipe again and again!!
This is a really nice margarita recipe. It is so much better with lime juice and not frozen limeade. I'll be making these all summer long!!

I was happy to find a recipe that uses all real ingredients instead of a limeade mix like the other recipes. I would add a little more sugar next time because I used individually quick frozen strawberries (no sugar) and they weren't that sweet. It's an easy thing to taste and add more as needed. I found the lime amount perfect. Will make again.
This is an enjoyable strawberry margarita. Next time I would cut back a smidgeon on the lime juice.
